title: School of Medicine
author: Greg Glasgow; September
cleaned_text: As a longtime researcher of respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), [Eric Simões](https://som.cuanschutz.edu/Profiles/Faculty/Profile/12060), MD, was gratified in August when clinical trials he led at the [University of Colorado School of Medicine](https://medschool.cuanschutz.edu/) received the U.S. Food and Drug Administration's approval for Pfizer's [new RSV vaccine for use during late pregnancy](https://www.childrenscolorado.org/about/news/2023/august-2023/rsv-prevention/). A new study led by researchers from the University of Colorado School of Medicine finds that patients, when given the option to use evidence-based medical weight management tools in a primary care setting, achieve better weight loss results compared to those who receive routine care.
